title: Rate law for decomposition of H2O2

content.question:
<math alttext="H 2 O 2 reacts to produce H 2 O plus one half O 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

Hydrogen peroxide decomposes to produce water and oxygen according to the equation above. An experimentally determined graph for the first-order decomposition of hydrogen peroxide is provided below.

Which of the following best identifies the rate constant <math alttext="k " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction based on the information in the plot of <math alttext="the natural log of the molar concentration of H 2 O 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ln[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> versus time (<math alttext="t " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) ?

choices.label: <math alttext="k equals the natural log of the molar concentration of H 2 O 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mtext>ln[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k equals the natural log of the molar concentration of H 2 O 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mtext>ln[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 500 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k equals negative, the slope of the plot " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>slope of plot</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k equals negative, the fraction 1 over the slope of the plot" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>slope of plot</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="k equals negative, the slope of the plot " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>slope of plot</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
